comments:
As can be seen from the following example, the error message does not 
include the file in which the error occured. It was, in fact, in one
of the two check files that had been run in the CheckComponent.

Check::validate:
throw new EvaluationException("Type not found : " + type.getValue(), type);

The argument 'type' is used to resolve the error location. But for types there can be no location.


Passed now 'this' (Check element) to the EvaluationException. The error message becomes clearer:
Type not found : MistypedNamedElement in Constraints on line 3 'MistypedNamedElement "Name must not be null"'

traces.message: Type not found : Operation in null on line 13 'Operation'
